segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 16
segments.en: Linked Discourses 16

segments.pli: 1. Kassapavagga
segments.en: 1. Kassapa

segments.pli: 6. Ovādasutta
segments.en: 6. Advice

segments.pli: Rājagahe veḷuvane.
segments.en: Near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahākassapo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho āyasmantaṃ mahākassapaṃ bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Venerable Mahākassapa went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to him:

segments.pli: “ovada, kassapa, bhikkhū;
segments.en: “Kassapa, advise the mendicants!

segments.pli: karohi, kassapa, bhikkhūnaṃ dhammiṃ kathaṃ.
segments.en: Give them a Dhamma talk!

segments.pli: Ahaṃ vā, kassapa, bhikkhū ovadeyyaṃ tvaṃ vā;
segments.en: Either you or I should advise the mendicants

segments.pli: ahaṃ vā bhikkhūnaṃ dhammiṃ kathaṃ kareyyaṃ tvaṃ vā”ti.
segments.en: and give them a Dhamma talk.”

segments.pli: “Dubbacā kho, bhante, etarahi bhikkhū, dovacassakaraṇehi dhammehi samannāgatā, akkhamā, appadakkhiṇaggāhino anusāsaniṃ.
segments.en: “Sir, the mendicants these days are hard to admonish, having qualities that make them hard to admonish. They’re impatient, and don’t take instruction respectfully.

segments.pli: Idhāhaṃ, bhante, addasaṃ bhaṇḍañca nāma bhikkhuṃ ānandassa saddhivihāriṃ abhijikañca nāma bhikkhuṃ anuruddhassa saddhivihāriṃ aññamaññaṃ sutena accāvadante:
segments.en: Take the monk called Bhaṇḍa, Ānanda’s pupil. He’s been competing in studies with the monk called Abhiñjika, Anuruddha’s pupil. They say:

segments.pli: ‘ehi, bhikkhu, ko bahutaraṃ bhāsissati, ko sundarataraṃ bhāsissati, ko cirataraṃ bhāsissatī’”ti.
segments.en: ‘Come on, monk, who can recite more? Who can recite better? Who can recite longer?’”

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā aññataraṃ bhikkhuṃ āmantesi:
segments.en: So the Buddha said to a certain monk,

segments.pli: “ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, mama vacanena bhaṇḍañca bhikkhuṃ ānandassa saddhivihāriṃ abhijikañca bhikkhuṃ anuruddhassa saddhivihāriṃ āmantehi:
segments.en: “Please, monk, in my name tell the monk called Bhaṇḍa, Ānanda’s pupil, and the monk called Abhiñjika, Anuruddha’s pupil that

segments.pli: ‘satthā āyasmante āmantetī’”ti.
segments.en: the teacher summons them.”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho so bhikkhu bhagavato paṭissutvā yena te bhikkhū tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā te bhikkhū etadavoca:
segments.en: “Yes, sir,” that monk replied. He went to those monks and said,

segments.pli: “satthā āyasmante āmantetī”ti.
segments.en: “Venerables, the teacher summons you.”

segments.pli: “Evamāvuso”ti kho te bhikkhū tassa bhikkhuno paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu. Ekamantaṃ nisinne kho te bhikkhū bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: “Yes, reverend,” those monks replied. They went to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to them:

segments.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, aññamaññaṃ sutena accāvadatha:
segments.en: “Is it really true, monks, that you’ve been competing in studies, saying:

segments.pli: ‘ehi, bhikkhu, ko bahutaraṃ bhāsissati, ko sundarataraṃ bhāsissati, ko cirataraṃ bhāsissatī’”ti?
segments.en: ‘Come on, monk, who can recite more? Who can recite better? Who can recite longer?’”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”.
segments.en: “Yes, sir.”

segments.pli: “Kiṃ nu kho me tumhe, bhikkhave, evaṃ dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānātha:
segments.en: “Have you ever known me to teach the Dhamma like this:

segments.pli: ‘etha tumhe, bhikkhave, aññamaññaṃ sutena accāvadatha—
segments.en: ‘Please mendicants, compete in studies to

segments.pli: ehi, bhikkhu, ko bahutaraṃ bhāsissati, ko sundarataraṃ bhāsissati, ko cirataraṃ bhāsissatī’”ti?
segments.en: see who can recite more and better and longer’?”

segments.pli: “No hetaṃ, bhante”.
segments.en: “No, sir.”

segments.pli: “No ce kira me tumhe, bhikkhave, evaṃ dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānātha, atha kiñcarahi tumhe, moghapurisā, kiṃ jānantā kiṃ passantā evaṃ svākkhāte dhammavinaye pabbajitā samānā aññamaññaṃ sutena accāvadatha:
segments.en: “If you’ve never known me to teach the Dhamma like this, then what exactly do you know and see, you foolish men, that after going forth in such a well explained teaching and training you’d compete in studies to

segments.pli: ‘ehi, bhikkhu, ko bahutaraṃ bhāsissati, ko sundarataraṃ bhāsissati, ko cirataraṃ bhāsissatī’”ti.
segments.en: see who can recite more and better and longer?”

segments.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato pādesu sirasā nipatitvā bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ:
segments.en: Then those monks bowed with their heads at the Buddha’s feet and said,

segments.pli: “accayo no, bhante, accagamā, yathābāle yathāmūḷhe yathāakusale, ye mayaṃ evaṃ svākkhāte dhammavinaye pabbajitā samānā aññamaññaṃ sutena accāvadimha:
segments.en: “We have made a mistake, sir. It was foolish, stupid, and unskillful of us in that after going forth in such a well explained teaching and training we competed in studies to

segments.pli: ‘ehi, bhikkhu, ko bahutaraṃ bhāsissati, ko sundarataraṃ bhāsissati, ko cirataraṃ bhāsissatī’ti.
segments.en: see who can recite more and better and longer.

segments.pli: Tesaṃ no, bhante, bhagavā accayaṃ accayato paṭiggaṇhātu āyatiṃ saṃvarāyā”ti.
segments.en: Please, sir, accept our mistake for what it is, so we will restrain ourselves in future.”

segments.pli: “Taggha tumhe, bhikkhave, accayo accagamā yathābāle yathāmūḷhe yathāakusale, ye tumhe evaṃ svākkhāte dhammavinaye pabbajitā samānā aññamaññaṃ sutena accāvadittha:
segments.en: “Indeed, monks, you made a mistake. It was foolish, stupid, and unskillful of you to act in that way.

segments.pli: ‘ehi, bhikkhu, ko bahutaraṃ bhāsissati, ko sundarataraṃ bhāsissati, ko cirataraṃ bhāsissatī’ti.
Yato ca kho tumhe, bhikkhave, accayaṃ accayato disvā yathādhammaṃ paṭikarotha, taṃ vo mayaṃ paṭiggaṇhāma.
segments.en: But since you have recognized your mistake for what it is, and have dealt with it properly, I accept it.

segments.pli: Vuddhi hesā, bhikkhave, ariyassa vinaye yo accayaṃ accayato disvā yathādhammaṃ paṭikaroti āyatiñca saṃvaraṃ āpajjatī”ti.
segments.en: For it is growth in the training of the noble one to recognize a mistake for what it is, deal with it properly, and commit to restraint in the future.”

segments.pli: Chaṭṭhaṃ.

sections.title: Near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove.

suttaplex.blurb: The Buddha invites Kassapa to teach the mendicants, but he is reluctant, since certain students of Anuruddha and Ānanda have been competing to see who can teach better.
